meanings.definition: Showing a lack of will or initiative
meanings.sent1: The abulic student struggled to start his homework.
meanings.sent2: She often felt abulic when faced with difficult tasks.
meanings.sent3: The abulic puppy refused to chase after the ball.
meanings.sent4: His abulic behavior was like a ship without a captain.
meanings.sent5: The image of the abulic man sitting on the park bench was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an inability to make decisions or take action
meanings.sent1: Her abulic nature made it hard for her to choose a movie to watch.
meanings.sent2: The abulic team couldn't decide on a strategy for the game.
meanings.sent3: The abulic squirrel couldn't pick which nut to eat first.
meanings.sent4: The abulic clock seemed frozen in time, unable to move forward.
meanings.sent5: The abulic clouds hung in the sky, undecided on whether to rain or shine.
